data.title: [Editor] ScriptInstance fix
data.body:
Minor fix so that all script instances have their values update when inspector is refreshed. 

This fixes an issue where, although the values are recalled, they would be unset on a save unless you select the ScriptInstance component (could occur when resource auto-reloads).

data.title: [Editor] Particle effect editor
data.body:
A particle effect (3d) editor for the Urho Editor.
- I added some things to ParticleEffect to make it a bit more like Material, so that the editor could use a similar approach for ColorFrames/TextureFrames (GetNumColorFrames / SetNumColorFrames, etc) and Undo/Redo (loading/saving to XMLElement).
- The attributes are 'hard coded' as ParticleEffect isn't Serializable and I didn't think of a better way.
- Includes a few ParticleEffect xml's.
- The PR also contains a few angelscript binding fixes for particles.

data.title: Dynamic Types
data.body:
Looking to address issues raised in #521, this allows a Sound Type to be defined via a StringHash or the old enum style and preserves loading the old enum style (but will not serialize it again in the future if the scene is exported).

Editor support added for managed Audio Master Gains. For user defined ones they ui element can be dragged onto a line edit to set the underlying string hash value into that field.

In addition to this allows Cursor Shapes to be defined in a similar manner while preserving the enum for UI, sdl and backwards compatibility (except in cases where GetShape is used as that no longer returns a CursorShape). However serialization has been refactored and is no longer backwards compatible, for example it now looks like:

```
            <variant type="VariantVector" >
                <variant type="String" value="Busy" />
                <variant type="ResourceRef" value="Image;Textures/UI.png" />
                <variant type="IntRect" value="128 64 148 85" />
                <variant type="IntVector2" value="9 9" />
            </variant>   
```

By no means a sure thing, only one way of doing this so feedback more than welcome.

data.title: Segfault when deleting a View3D
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:

Add these lines at the end of CreateScene() in 04_StaticScene.lua:

``` lua
view3D = ui.root:CreateChild("View3D")
view3D:SetSize(300, 200)
view3D:SetView(scene_, cameraNode:GetComponent("Camera"))
```

Add this line at the end of HandleUpdate():

``` lua
if input:GetKeyDown(KEY_V) then view3D:delete() end -- Also tested with Remove()
```

Run script and press "V" key.

data.title: StaticModelGroup only render one instance if using alpha material
data.body:
As the title said, if I use solid material (ex: stone tiled), it works as it should:
![static_model_group_stone_tiled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5253453/5218129/af89c01a-767b-11e4-8d2e-55c678c7ce4e.jpg)
But, if I change to material that use alpha channel (ex: lit smoke), it only render one instance:
![static_model_group_lit_smoke](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5253453/5218136/c692fa42-767b-11e4-8c72-d33f59fa2bb8.jpg)

It's looks like a bug.

data.title: When setting a new sprite, have to mark vertices dirty to pick up changes in rectangle, hotspot, etc
RPI CI builds are forced to be terminated prematurely because bad VM image does not have enough memory to git clone a full sysroot
data.body: Since we are only using the Raspberry Pi sysroot so that we can perform a rooted CMake library search instead of using it for launching RPI OS in QEMU emulator, in theory we should be able to create a stripped down version of the sysroot just for CMake need.

data.title: [Editor] ScriptInstance attribute persistance
data.body:
This PR:
- Editor will no longer change ScriptInstance attributes behind your back if an error is thrown in a script (as long as you correct the error / don't save while the error exists ...).
- Drag editing undo history is cleaned up.

data.title: [Editor] Remember user variables across scenes
data.body: Store the names of user vars (which are stored as hashes in the nodes and therefore aren't human-readable) in an editor configuration file to remember them across scenes/prefabs.

data.title: [Editor] Maintain ScriptInstance values when script has error
data.body:
At the moment, it seems that when a ScriptInstance has an error, any values entered in the attribute inspector are reset, which makes for a problematic workflow.

It would be good if some mapping was maintained within an editor session to prevent these issues, and even if later you decide to delete some variable and add it again (within the same editor session), the previous value could be set.

data.title: Node::Remove does not remove nodes/components from scene
data.body:
I am wondering if I am trying to remove nodes from the scene incorrectly.  When they are removed, the scene ptr, etc is all still valid and their components continue to draw.  As a sanity test, I tried removing the nodes from the Sprite example in the update loop:

https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Samples/24_Urho2DSprite/Urho2DSprite.cpp#L238

I also tried node->ResetScene().  The nodes/sprite components still rendered.

I would think removing the node from the scene, should clean up the scene ptrs and not render the node's components anymore, or am I missing something?

Thanks!

data.title: Uncompressed DDS support
data.body:
Urho3D always returns 'ERROR: Unsupported DDS format' when using uncompressed dds texture. 

Does Urho haven't support this format yet?

data.title: Android CI builds are forced to be terminated prematurely because bad VM image does not have enough memory to install Android NDK r10c
data.body:
Previously we could install NDK r9d regardless of whether the CI build find itself runs in a bad VM with insufficient memory or not. The 10c is huge because it contains too many toolchains (over 25 combinations of ABI/GCC/Clang/LLVM) and too many platforms (API level 3 to level 21), so that could be a contributing factor besides the delivery format is changed from tar.bz2 to 7z self-extracting archive.

I have reported the memory issue to Travis-CI.org and also have requested them to pre-install the NDK r10c into their Android CI environment (https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/2946), however, I won't hold my breath for it to happen any time soon. Thus, we need to find an alternative way in the meantime.

data.title: Number of CPUs not implemented on Android
data.body:
This would be nice to have. Currently defaults to 1 with todo comments in `ProcessUtils.cpp`. If the `GetNumLogicalCPUs` is hard to dig out, it could just return same as `GetNumPhysicalCPUs`.

I'm currently relying on Urho to report number of logical cores for my own threading logic and I always get 1. My S3 should have quad core that would speed stuff up if reported correctly :)

I found this from chromium source tree with google. Looks useful. Not sure if the NDK in the path hints that these functions are available in NDK already?

https://chromium.googlesource.com/android_tools/+/704c8ddee726aabe0e78bb88545972d2cf298190/ndk/sources/android/cpufeatures/cpu-features.h

data.title: Bug fix: editor mouse could be trapped in virtual cursor mode.
data.body:
Input::SetMouseMode and Console::SetVisible were keeping track of last mouse visible independently, which could cause mouse to become trapped in editor (eg: drag slider + open console + press escape).

Now a unified way of hiding the mouse and recalling the 'true' visibility is provided via SetMouseVisible(bool enable, bool supressEvent) and ResetMouseVisible().

data.body:
Im getting this error:

[Wed Nov 19 13:40:37 2014] ERROR: Scripts/Editor/EditorSettings.as:44,5 - Exception 'Null pointer access' in 'void UpdateEditorSettingsDialog()'
AngelScript callstack:

The editor runs, but 2 windows are missing, and cant load scenes. The problem started with commits from last weekend or so, before that, it ran perfectly. both Windows and Linux platforms are affected.

data.title: crash when deleting the node
data.body:
Win 7 64bit, opengl, deferred renderer, 32 bit build. Source updated to recent. Angel script.

Similar issue to #483 I have a bullet node with:
*Rigidbody
*CollisionShape
*StaticModel with few Value Animations
*ScriptInstance subscribed to "NodeCollisionStart" which deletes the own node(bullet) after hiting the wall(the wall is convex hull from mesh)

It's worth noting that the crash does not occur if I disable the node and then remove like:
node.enabled=false;
node.Remove();
 I'm also trying to unsubscribe everything what comes to my mind before removing the node.
UnsubscribeFromAllEvents();
UnsubscribeFromEvents(node);
UnsubscribeFromEvents(self);

Edit:
I built debug version of urho3dplayer and it isn't crashing at the moment of impact but instead it stops debugging and:
"Run-Time Check Failure #0 - The value of ESP was not properly saved across a function call.  This is usually a result of calling a function declared with one calling convention with a function pointer declared with a different calling convention."

and stops on line 292 in btConvexShape.cpp
Also if I click continue in debugger and ignore that runtime failure then it continues to run the program without crash until next bullet hit on the wall.

This bug seems to be very random. I will stick to disabling nodes before removing them for now.

data.body: Yes GCC pch files have a gch extension.  The CMake setting that is causing the issue of it appearing in the Source directory when enabled should probably be looked in to sometime.  I verified these do not match anything that they should not.

Fix division by 0 in horizontal Edge constructor
Fix valgrind warning about mismatched new/delete in Profiler.h
data.body: Mostly a hygienic fix.

data.title: SDK Cleanup
data.body:
Hi!

I have refactored the work i have done, this time following every guideline i have been told:
- Each commit includes changes to only one library.
- Every time a library is being refactored, the first commit is for moving the files, the second commit is for changing code.

I have checked that there is no regression in any commit, it appears that the code is built on top of the very latest Urho3D version, as opposed to last time (Alex pointed me to some code being reverted by my changes, probably because of my editor settings... Still a mistery for me.).

Only the kNet source code is changed. A few files from the SDL are also changed, but most of them were generated from the SDL ./configure step, which means that they should be automatically reflecting those changes the next time a new version of the SDL is merged to Urho3D.

An ultimate change i have done is to allow all headers from Bullet to be installed in the SDK (As opposed to the vanilla version of Urho3D, which only installs the LinearMath headers). This is to allow programmers to use the whole Bullet environment since the library is statically linked, all symbols are present in Urho3D lib. This could be easily reverted if needed.

The result (After running make package) is a self-contained SDK that only requires one include path (SDKPath/include/Urho3D) instead of many.

Please tell me if everything fits.

data.title: "Released" event handler 'triggered' with spacebar
data.body:
Currently experiencing very strange behavior with "Released" event 'triggered' when pressing space bar.

Steps to reproduce:

In 02_HelloGUI.lua, add these lines at the end of InitControls() function:

```
local newbutton = ui.root:CreateChild("Button")
newbutton:SetSize(200, 200)
SubscribeToEvent(newbutton, "Released", "HandleNewButton")
```

Then create this function:

```
function HandleNewButton(eventType, eventData)
    print("NewButton Clicked")
end
```

Now, after clicking on the new button, pressing spacebar will always trigger the HandleNewButton() function. (as long as new button is not clicked, nothing weird happens).

Notes:
- Tested with a 3 months-old release and latest release, so recent UI changes are not guilty
- Also tested with AngelScript
- Doesn't occur in '-touch' mode.

data.title: Option in ParticleEmitter to disable serialization of particles
data.body:
I have some fire particle emitters with large number of particles. It performs quite well but the problem is that the serialisation process takes long time and what is more important - the scenes saved in current way are huge(about 200MB as xml and 30MB as binary) and most of the data in saved scene are positions, rotation, colors etc of the particles.

It would be nice to have ability to set some flag in ParticleEmitter so the particles wouldn't be serialized.

data.title: Fixed Enums for defining number of Types (Sound, CursorShape, etc)
data.body:
One of the problems I've come across recently is that things such as CursorShape and SoundType are fixed enums which don't always fit whats required by the game. For example in CursorShape it's limited to the OS Cursor types and say in a strategy I'm going to want different shapes depending on the context of the 3d scene I'm mousing over and not just UI but currently this requires changes to Urho source.

It's easy enough to change this to a dynamic implementation but it's difficult to preserve backward compatibility without dirtying the code providing work arounds that convert the old enums into the new dynamic format.

Happy to do so if its preferred just thought I'd get a few opinions on whether we always want backwards compatibility.
